frameDefinitions: This frame contains adjectives and nouns that describe the truth or sincerity of communication.
An object (the Theme) moves away from a Source.
A Cause leads to the formation of a Created_entity.
Some Content is part of the mental model of a Cognizer.
In this frame a Source_emitter discharges its Emission along a Path or to a Goal.  ' (1) The factory exudes toxic fumes from three large chimneys.'
In this frame an Emission emanates from a Source along a Path or to a Goal.
frameExamples: Evelyn was <t>candid</t> with me about the party.
(1) The factory <t>exudes</t> toxic fumes from three large chimneys.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Speaker</fen> produces the <fen>Message</fen>, the truth or sincerity of which is at issue. It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the <t>target</t> word, or as the Nominal Head of prenominal uses.

<fen>Message</fen> is the communicative content whose truth or sincerity is at issue. This role does not normally co-occur with the other FEs in this frame. When it does occur, it is normally the External Argument of a predicative use of the <t>Target</t> word, or the modified Nominal Head in a prenominal use.

The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It often occurs without the <fen>Message</fen> role in predicative uses of the <t>target</t> word. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about'.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
This is the object which moves. It may be an entity which moves under its own power, but it need not be.

All the verbs in this frame express some change of location, away from one place and to another. Any constituent that expresses the initial position of the <fen>Theme</fen>, before the change of location, is tagged with <fen>Source</fen>. Often the <fen>Source</fen> is understood from context.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the departure takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the location in which the departing takes place.
This role identifies the entity that the Agent intentionally creates.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>s.
The <fen>Creator</fen> creates a created entity.
This role identifes the Time when an Agent intentionally creates a new entity.
This role identifies the place ehere the Agent intentionally creates the new entity.
The fact or idea which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is aware of.
The category whose applicability to the <fen>Content</fen> is known.
The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has awareness (or lack thereof) of the <fen>Content</fen>.
The <fen>Source_emitter</fen> is the item  from which the <fen>Emission</fen> are discharged.
The <fen>Emission</fen>s are discharged out of the <fen>Source_emitter</fen> .
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when  the <fen>Source_emitter</fen> emits the <fen>Emission</fen>.
The <fen>Emission</fen>s are discharged out of the <fen>Source</fen> .
The <fen>Source</fen> is the location from which the <fen>Emission</fen> emanates.
This role identifies the time when the emanation occurs.
listRoleExamples: Evelyn made some candid remarks <fex>in French</fex>.
<fex>That most of them are dangerous</fex> is not yet known.
The patient arrived with a suspected <fex>broken leg</fex>.
The <fex>long</fex> suspected killer has now released a statement outlining his thoughts on the criminal case.
